10:39 <vmassol> good morning eveyrone  
10:40 <vmassol> guys, WDYT about having a custom Hibernate UserType for all String fields for which content comes from the user (ie its size is unknown). That UserType would do the trimming.  
10:40 <vmassol> sdumitriu, wdyt?  
10:42 <vmassol> (actually only for free form content fields obviously)  
10:42 <sburjan> has quit  
10:43 <vmassol> I find this nicer than having to do the trimming in the business code, since this is a storage concern

13:56 <sdumitriu> vmassol: WDYM? Hibernate custom type that always trims the content, so that we don't get database exceptions about too large values?  
13:56 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes  
13:56 <vmassol> but in the end I didn't do it  
13:56 <vmassol> I tested it though  
13:56 <vmassol> but for some reason I haven't fathomed my trim happened too late in the process  
13:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <vmassol> dbcp called hsqldb which raised the data truncation error before the hibernate custom type could do the trim  
13:57 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <vmassol> anyway this is something we'll need to revisit in the future  
13:57 <vmassol> because there are lots of verifications we don't do  
13:57 <vmassol> we need to have a common agreement/decision on how we want to treat those  
13:58 <vmassol> in my commit earlier on I added the check in XWikiHibenrateStore  
13:58 <vmassol> (for the comment column)  
13:58 <vmassol> (I also didn't research how to get the mapping max col length from inside the custom user type class)

14:00 <vmassol> doing it now  
14:07 <vmassol> msmeria: what I meant, is that we need to be careful about closing issues quickly without trying to resolve them  
14:07 <vmassol> In this case I wasn't sure he had done everything we could  
14:07 <vmassol> we did'nt ask much to the user to try to understand the problem  
14:07 <vmassol> from a user POV, it's like saying "I don't care about your problem. It works for me, so go away..."  
14:09 <vmassol> This is ok for old issues, especially if the user hasn't answered our questions but here it's relatively recent and he is answering so far...  
14:09 <vmassol> do you agree?  
14:09 <msmeria> vmassol: I don't know what to say. if you want I can reopen the issue, but I still think it has something to do with the user's PC configuration  
14:09 <vmassol> msmeria: then why don't we understand it?  
14:09 <vmassol> what question did you ask to narrow the problem?  
14:10 <vmassol> xwiki is supposed to work everywhere and if it doesn't then we need to document that  
14:10 <vmassol> apparently the guy can reproduce every time right?  
14:10 <msmeria> Sorin asked the user to test on 5.0 m1 and he could still reproduce it  
14:10 <msmeria> yes  
14:10 <vmassol> so it's not intermittent  
14:10 <vmassol> did we ask what user he used?  
14:11 <vmassol> admin vs other

14:11 <msmeria> no, we didn't  
14:11 <vmassol> retrying is not going to help  
14:11 <vmassol> we didn't change anything for months/years on the installer  
14:11 <msmeria> yes, that's right  
14:11 <vmassol> (retrying with a newer version that is)  
14:11 <msmeria> and the installer always worked for me and never worked for him  
14:11 <vmassol> all I'm saying is that the issue still exists IMO  
14:11 <vmassol> and if he has it  
14:11 <msmeria> that's why I think it's not really an issue with the installer  
14:11 <vmassol> then others have it too  
14:12 <msmeria> ok. do you want me to reopen it ?  
14:13 <vmassol> your choice, just make sure the user is a happy user  
14:13 <msmeria> :)  
14:13 <vmassol> is it blocking him?  
14:13 <vmassol> has he foudn a workaound?  
14:13 <vmassol> etc

14:13 <vmassol> we cannot close an issue at his face like this  
14:13 <vmassol> just ask him in comments

20:24 <szrrizvi> sdumitriu: Hello, I was wondering if I could bother you with a few more questions today.  
20:26 <szrrizvi> I am trying to find the source code, so that I can have a local copy to work with. But I am having trouble figuring out which repositories I should be working with.  
20:30 <sdumitriu> Hi szrrizvi  
20:30 <szrrizvi> Hello sdumitriu  
20:31 <sdumitriu> Well, it depends on what you're trying to do  
20:31 <sdumitriu> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SourceRepository says what each repository is for  
20:32 <szrrizvi> I am trying to get a very generic version of XWiki, so that I can play around with the back end source code and see how it works.  
20:32 <sdumitriu> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-security/xwiki-platform-security-api is where the access rights APIs are defined  
20:33 <szrrizvi> From what I understand, I would need the Platform and Enterprise repositories. Does that sound correct?  
20:33 <sdumitriu> Yes  
20:33 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
20:34 <sdumitriu> You probably don't have to change the rendering engine, so you don't need xwiki-rendering  
20:34 <sdumitriu> And xwiki-commons is also mostly stable code that users rarely need to change  
20:34 <sdumitriu> So yes, you'll make changes in xwiki-platform  
20:34 <sdumitriu> Build that one, then build xwiki-enterprise to get a working wiki  
20:35 <szrrizvi> OK, thank you. Earlier, I was trying to browse the repository, but I was only finding XML files.
